#summary Vector module Lua API.

= Introduction =

Once created, vectors are immutable. Vector elements may be accessed either by an index or by a string. For example
{{{
v = vec.new(1, 2, 3, 4)
print(v[1])   -- returns 1
print(v["y"]) -- returns 2
print(v.z)    -- returns 3
}}}

New vectors can also be created by _swizzling_. For example
{{{
v.xy   -- returns vec(1, 2, 0, 0)
v.yzw  -- returns vec(2, 3, 4, 0)
v.xxyz -- returns vec(1, 1, 2, 3)
}}}


= Vector API =

The vector module brings the following new functions into Lua.

 * *vec.new(x, y, z, w)*: Returns a new vector initialized with the given elements.
 * *vec.dot(a, b)*: Returns the dot product of two given vectors.
 * *vec.cross(a, b)*: Returns the cross prodict of two given vectors.
 * *vec.length(v)*: Returns the length of the given vector.
 * *vec.normalize(v)*: Returns the normalized vector of the given vector.

The module also contains the following variables:

 * *vec.zero*: Equivalent of vec(0, 0, 0, 0).
 * *vec.one*: Equivalent of vec(1, 1, 1, 1).
